Key Match Events: Christos Tzolis scored twice for Greece, but both efforts were blocked by Manuel Neuer.
Giorgos Masouras scored for Greece in the 33rd minute after Neuer spilled a shot.
Manuel Neuer made several saves, particularly in the first half, including blocking shots from Christos Tzolis.
Kai Havertz equalized for Germany in the 55th minute with a deflected shot.
Pascal Gross scored the winning goal for Germany in the 89th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann confirmed he was cutting Stuttgart goalkeeper Alexander Nübel as he finalized the 26-player squad for the tournament.
Nagelsmann committed to having Neuer as his first-choice goalkeeper for Euro 2024 despite injuries.
Nagelsmann acknowledged the team's mistakes and addressed them at halftime.
Post-Match Reflections: Toni Kroos commented on the team's mistakes in the first half and their improved focus in the second half.
Julian Nagelsmann expressed satisfaction with the second half's performance and mentioned the upcoming match against Scotland.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was held at Borussia-Park in Mönchengladbach, Germany.
Referees were José Luis Munuera Montero.
